ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: the Fire that shall rise to the hearts (of criminals).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Which will climb on to the hearts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Which leaps up over the hearts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Which leapeth up over the hearts (of men).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Reaching right into the hearts of men,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Which mounteth up to the hearts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Which leaps up over the hearts,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Which mounts directed at the hearts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [104:7] which peers over the hearts, to burn them — the pain of which is much more severe than any other because of the delicate nature [of the heart].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Which leapeth up over the hearts (of men)) which consumes everything until it reaches the hearts.
